prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A pianist who can't play a lick. Formerly an ace defense attorney of some renown.
Character 1
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: Future star magician, and Phoenix Wright's daughter. Fond of her Mr. Hat trick.
Character 2
Name: Klavier Gavin
Description: Star prosecutor and leader/vocalist for the rock group, the Gavinners.
Character 3
Name: LeTouse
Description: Lamiroir's interpreter. His first name is "Romein".
Character 4
Name: Lamiroir
Description: Singer lauded as the "Siren of the Ballad", from the tiny country of Borginia.
Character 5
Name: Machi Tobaye
Description: Lamiroir's favorite pianist. He is blind.
Character 6
Name: Ema Skye
Description: Detective obsessed with forensics. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 7
Name: Daryan Crescend
Description: Guitarist for the Gavinners. His day job is as a detective in Criminal Affairs, Div. 3.
Character 8
Name: Valant Gramarye
Description: Famous magician, often on TV. Fond of exaggeration.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.
Evidence 1
Name: Postcard
Description: Lamiroir's own publicity postcard. Click here for details.
Evidence 2
Name: Lyrics Sheet
Description: Contains the lyrics to Lamiroir's ballad. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Investigation Request
Description: Information concerning the crime to be restricted to police and related parties.
Evidence 4
Name: Brooch
Description: Found at the crime scene. Seems strangely familiar... Found at the crime scene. Turns out it belongs to Lamiroir.
Evidence 5
Name: Revolver
Description: The murder weapon.  A deadly, high-caliber revolver. The murder weapon. A deadly, high-caliber revolver belonging to Mr. LeTouse.
Evidence 6
Name: Key Ring
Description: Mr. LeTouse died clutching this. Note the heart-shaped ring. Found in the victim's left hand. Holds keys to a guitar case and a motorcycle.
Evidence 7
Name: Mixing Board
Description: Allows music to be played in separate tracks. Click here to use.
Evidence 8
Name: LeTouse's Autopsy Report
Description: Death due to loss of blood from a gunshot wound. Est. time of death: 9:00-9:30 PM.
Evidence 9
Name: Crime Photo
Description: Victim shot in shoulder in Lamiroir's room. [caption] The victim was lying head down on the floor, his face turned to the left. There is smeared writing in blood on the floor in front of his head next to his right hand.
Evidence 10
Name: Diagram
Description: The crime scene was Lamiroir's dressing room. [caption] Observing from the door, the victim was blocked from sight by items. There was a gun next to the victim's body. Two bullet holes were found on the wall where the door was.
I... looked into the room. Just a glance, mind you.
Evidence 11
Name: Video Tape
Description: Taped recording of Lamiroir's performance. Click here for details.
Evidence 12
Name: Headset
Description: Retrieved from Backstage Hallway. Receiver/transmitter for voice signals. All concert staff wore one. Receiver/transmitter for voice signals with a 30-foot range. All concert staff wore one.
Evidence 13
Name: Switch → Remote Trigger
Description: Found on the stage. It's a switch for something, and that's about all I know. Found on the stage. Triggers an igniter. Use with caution. Found on the stage. Triggers an igniter within 30 feet.
Evidence 14
Name: Forum Diagram
Description: Cross-section diagram of the Sunshine Coliseum. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Igniter
Description: Found at the crime scene. Emits a flame when triggered by remote control. Identical igniters in Gavin's guitar and at the crime scene. Triggered by "Remote Trigger".
Evidence 16
Name: Borginian Newspaper
Description: Article about the case. It doesn't mention the lyrics of Lamiroir's ballad.
Evidence 17
Name: Prosecutor Gavin's Guitar
Description: A gift from Lamiroir, sent from Borginia. Burned the night of the concert.
Evidence 18
Name: Replica
Description: Replica of something, held by Mr. LeTouse. Apparently the focus of his investigation. Borginia Cocoon replica, held by Mr. LeTouse. Replica of a cocoon from which a remedy for "incuritis" may be extracted.
Evidence 19
Name: Newspaper Article
Description: Article about the Chief Justice's son, who is inflicted with "incuritis".
Evidence 20
Name: Burnt Fragments
Description: Found at the crime scene, bearing a gunpowder residue. Possibly a firecracker?

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: As for what I saw... I saw nothing.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 1
Testimony: That night, I was invited to sing on stage, and this I did.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 2
Testimony: I did not return backstage after the second set.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 3
Testimony: When my performance was finished, I went backstage for just a moment...
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 4
Testimony: I saw nothing. The late Mr. LeTouse's body was behind a wall.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 5
Testimony: I saw bullet holes in the wall, and knew Mr. LeTouse had been shot...
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 6
Testimony: Then I was led by the police to Mr. Gavin's dressing room, and told to wait there.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 7
Testimony: That was where I learned that something had happened... But I wasn't told the details.
Person: Lamiroir

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by understanding the scenario.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. The main ones are Phoenix Wright, Trucy Wright, Klavier Gavin, LeTouse, Lamiroir, Machi Tobaye, Ema Skye, Daryan Crescend, and Valant Gramarye. The victim is LeTouse, who was found shot in the shoulder in Lamiroir's dressing room.

Now, let's examine the evidences provided:

- **Evidence 0**: Attorney's Badge - Not directly relevant to the contradiction.
- **Evidence 1**: Postcard - Lamiroir's publicity postcard.
- **Evidence 2**: Lyrics Sheet - Contains the lyrics to Lamiroir's ballad.
- **Evidence 3**: Investigation Request - About restricting crime info to police.
- **Evidence 4**: Brooch - Found at the crime scene, belongs to Lamiroir.
- **Evidence 5**: Revolver - Murder weapon, belongs to LeTouse.
- **Evidence 6**: Key Ring - Found in LeTouse's hand, has keys to a guitar case and motorcycle.
- **Evidence 7**: Mixing Board - For separate music tracks.
- **Evidence 8**: LeTouse's Autopsy Report - Death by gunshot wound, time between 9:00-9:30 PM.
- **Evidence 9**: Crime Photo - Victim shot in the shoulder, blood writing on the floor.
- **Evidence 10**: Diagram - Crime scene layout, victim behind items, gun next to body, bullet holes on the wall.
- **Evidence 11**: Video Tape - Recording of Lamiroir's performance.
- **Evidence 12**: Headset - For voice signals, all staff wore one.
- **Evidence 13**: Switch (Remote Trigger) - Triggers an igniter within 30 feet.
- **Evidence 14**: Forum Diagram - Layout of the Sunshine Coliseum.
- **Evidence 15**: Igniter - Found at the crime scene, emits flame when triggered by remote.
- **Evidence 16**: Borginian Newspaper - Article about the case, no mention of ballad lyrics.
- **Evidence 17**: Prosecutor Gavin's Guitar - Gift from Lamiroir, burned the night of the concert.
- **Evidence 18**: Replica - Of a Borginian cocoon, held by LeTouse.
- **Evidence 19**: Newspaper Article - About the Chief Justice's son with "incuritis."
- **Evidence 20**: Burnt Fragments - Found at the crime scene, possibly a firecracker.

Now, looking at the testimonies from Lamiroir:

- **Testimony 0**: Claims she saw nothing.
- **Testimony 1**: She was invited to sing on stage and did so.
- **Testimony 2**: She did not return backstage after the second set.
- **Testimony 3**: She went backstage for a moment after her performance.
- **Testimony 4**: She saw nothing because the victim was behind a wall.
- **Testimony 5**: She saw bullet holes and knew LeTouse was shot.
- **Testimony 6**: She was led to Gavin's dressing room by police.
- **Testimony 7**: She learned something happened but wasn't told details.

Now, I need to find a contradiction between any evidence and testimony.

Looking at **Testimony 3**, Lamiroir says she went backstage for just a moment after her performance. However, **Testimony 2** says she did not return backstage after the second set. This seems contradictory because she can't have both gone backstage and not gone backstage.

Additionally, **Evidence 9** (Crime Photo) shows the victim was shot in the shoulder, and there's blood writing on the floor. **Testimony 5** mentions she saw bullet holes and knew LeTouse was shot, which aligns with the evidence. However, **Testimony 4** claims she saw nothing because the victim was behind a wall, which contradicts the crime photo showing the victim's position and the fact that she admitted seeing bullet holes.

Moreover, **Evidence 4** (Brooch) was found at the crime scene and belongs to Lamiroir. If she was backstage, as she claims in Testimony 3, how did her brooch end up at the crime scene? This could indicate she was present when the crime occurred, contradicting her claim of not seeing anything.

Another point is **Evidence 15** (Igniter) and **Evidence 13** (Remote Trigger). If the igniter was triggered remotely, it suggests premeditation. However, **Testimony 5** indicates she saw bullet holes, implying a direct shooting, which might not involve a remote trigger. This could be a contradiction if the crime involved both shooting and ignition.

But the most direct contradiction seems to be between **Testimony 2** and **Testimony 3**. Lamiroir cannot both have not returned backstage and have gone backstage after her performance. This inconsistency in her testimony suggests she might be hiding something or providing false information.

Therefore, the contradiction lies between **Testimony 2** and **Testimony 3**, where Lamiroir's statements about returning backstage are inconsistent.
</think>

cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by going through the characters, evidences, and testimonies provided.

First, the characters include Phoenix Wright, Trucy Wright, Klavier Gavin, LeTouse, Lamiroir, Machi Tobaye, Ema Skye, Daryan Crescend, and Valant Gramarye. From the descriptions, it seems like LeTouse is the victim, and Lamiroir is a singer from Borginia. Machi Tobaye is Lamiroir's pianist and is blind. Ema Skye is the detective in charge of the investigation.

Now, looking at the evidences, there's a revolver (Evidence 5) which is the murder weapon belonging to LeTouse. There's also a crime photo (Evidence 9) showing the victim shot in the shoulder in Lamiroir's room, with smeared writing in blood on the floor. The lyrics sheet (Evidence 2) contains the lyrics to Lamiroir's ballad. The burnt fragments (Evidence 20) found at the crime scene have gunpowder residue and might be firecrackers.

The testimonies are from Ema Skye. She mentions that she believes Machi stole the body because of some lyrics (Testimony 0), that he moved the body to match Lamiroir's song (Testimony 1), that no one in the country had a motive to kill the victim (Testimony 2), that Machi practically left his signature at the scene (Testimony 3), that all evidence points to the defendant (Testimony 4), and that the shooter was likely blind (Testimony 5).

I need to find a contradiction between an evidence and a testimony. Let's analyze each testimony against the evidence.

Testimony 0: Ema believes Machi stole the body because of some lyrics. The lyrics sheet (Evidence 2) contains the lyrics to Lamiroir's ballad. If the lyrics are about moving a body or something similar, this could support Ema's testimony. However, if the lyrics don't mention anything about moving a body or stealing, then there's a contradiction.

Testimony 1: She says Machi moved the body to match Lamiroir's song. Again, if the lyrics (Evidence 2) don't mention moving a body or matching the song's narrative, this could contradict her testimony.

Testimony 2: She claims no one in the country had a motive to kill the victim. However, the burnt fragments (Evidence 20) might indicate a different motive, like a firecracker being used, suggesting someone else might have had a reason.

Testimony 3: She states that Machi left his signature at the scene. If there's no evidence of Machi's signature or any unique identifier, this could be a contradiction.

Testimony 4: She says all evidence points to the defendant. If there's evidence pointing elsewhere, like the burnt fragments (Evidence 20) suggesting another method or person, this could contradict her.

Testimony 5: She concludes the shooter was blind. Machi is blind, so this testimony aligns with that fact. However, if the evidence shows that the shooter wasn't blind, this would contradict her.

Looking closely, the crime photo (Evidence 9) shows the victim shot in the shoulder, with smeared writing in blood. If the writing is legible or points to someone else, it might contradict Ema's testimonies. However, the key contradiction seems to be between the burnt fragments (Evidence 20) and Testimony 2, where Ema claims no one had a motive, but the fragments suggest another angle.

But focusing on Testimony 5, where Ema says the shooter was blind, and considering Machi is blind, this seems to align. However, if the evidence shows that the shooter wasn't blind, that would be a contradiction. Since there's no evidence directly contradicting the shooter's blindness, perhaps another pair is better.

The lyrics sheet (Evidence 2) and Testimony 0: If the lyrics don't mention stealing a body, Ema's belief is unsupported, creating a contradiction.

Alternatively, the burnt fragments (Evidence 20) suggesting a firecracker and Testimony 2, where Ema claims no one had a motive, could contradict if the fragments imply an external motive.

I think the strongest contradiction is between Evidence 2 (lyrics sheet) and Testimony 0, where Ema's belief about the lyrics leading to the body theft isn't supported by the actual lyrics.
</think>
